Sapience is often defined as wisdom, or the ability of an organism or entity to act with appropriate [[Value judgment|judgment]], a mental faculty which is a component of [[Intelligence (trait)|intelligence]] or alternatively may be considered an additional faculty, apart from intelligence, with its own properties. [[Robert Sternberg]]<ref>{{cite book|last = Sternberg|first = Robert J.|authorlink = Robert Sternberg|title = Wisdom, Intelligence, and Creativity Synthesized|publisher = [[Cambridge University Press]]|year = 2003|location = New York|isbn = 0-521-80238-5 }}</ref> has segregated the capacity for judgment from the general qualifiers for intelligence, which is closer to cognizant aptitude than to wisdom. Displaying sound judgment in a complex, dynamic environment is a hallmark of wisdom.
